messageBody:
RE: [junit] test with private methd

Hi,

I started out with the idea of making the test cases having the same package as the classes under test, but I decided that this was messy, partly because you have to work around anyway

when accessing private fields/methods.

There is one basic solution:  Use the Java reflection API to access private fields and methods.  Someone else mentioned JUnitX - I've just had a brief look at it, it looks like it uses this method to make it possible to do what you ask.

Gabriel
